Assistant: This is a pretty open-ended question!  Most people in the US get around by using gasoline-powered automobiles, though electric vehicles are available and gaining market share. Most people use both gasoline-powered vehicles and electric vehicles for their driving needs.  However, electric vehicles are best-suited for low-traffic areas like the suburbs or country, where there are not many other people on the road to cause traffic and congestion.  So electric vehicles are used most by urban people who don’t own a garage or by families with many kids.

Human: Are they dangerous?

Assistant: Not at all.  If used properly, they are completely safe.  The biggest risk is that the batteries might fail.  But those batteries are also being improved all the time, so it’s expected that the failure rate will continue to decrease over time.
